newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK gold ends shade down despite shortcovering.
newsitem.headline: HK gold ends shade down despite shortcovering.

text.p: Hong Kong's gold market ended a shade down on Tuesday from its previous New York close despite a bout of shortcovering that pulled the metal up just before the market close, dealers said.
Bullion ended at US$350.50/351.00 an ounce against New York's US$350.70/351.20 close on Monday.
Trading was sporadic with sentiment neutral, dealers said.
"I don't know where the selling interest came from," said one dealer.
Shortcovering in the latter part of the afternoon session, mainly from European punters, pulled gold up just before the close.
Traders saw gold range trading between $348 per ounce and $352 per ounce.
Local gold ended HK$10 higher at HK$3,244 a tael.
The carry over charge at the Chinese Gold and Silver Exchange Society rose to -6.90 from its previous fix at -8.00.
